attributes.action: Award the Bevin Boy Commemorative Badge posthumously
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Prime Minister,

Having heard of the governments' recent recognition of the vital role
carried out during WW2 by the Bevin Boys by issuing a commemorative
badge, I have made enquiries on behalf of my grandfather who sadly
passed away a few years since.

I have been informed that the badge will not be issued posthumously; I
find this totally disgraceful after a period in excess of 60 years to
achieve their much deserved recognition! I would imagine that the
majority of the Bevin Boys have since passed away in any case!

I have to express that once again I am utterly disgusted with this outrageous and disrespectful decision!

I feel that many other families would be delighted to see this much deserved
recognition be awarded to Bevin Boys that have since passed away, in
recognition of their vital service to their country. I would also
imagine that they too would feel extremely bitter about the decision to
award the badge to survivors only. 

Yours sincerely,

Andrew Wright
